title: This seems harder than it should be.
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024944im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_8081_6302.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024944im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_8070_5743.jpg)

I'm trying to replicate a sign for my father-in-law's old business. Photos are from letter head and ashtray. The font is normally not degraded but it's a magnified photo on linen paper.

It's similar to Marlowe Cocktail and Yasashii but certainly neither of those. Thanks in advance.
author: spellerer

comments.content:
Lovely Art Deco lettering.  
I believe this design was probably handmade and the letterhead was engraved. Not certain as to the technique for the ashtray.  
I agree with your call of Yasashii as a similar that could be adapted.  
You might also look at Ultra Modern [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/ultra-modern-rr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024944/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/ultra-modern-rr/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/ultra-modern-rr/") for ideas as to how to do additional letters if you want to extend the alphabet.  
Don
